programme.desc: Animals wage a covert war for survival, deploying their hidden weapons with deadly precision. These adaptations, forged by eons of evolution, give animals the edge they need to outwit predators, rivals, and the elements. From the bombardier beetle's boiling spray to the mantis shrimp's explosive club and the draco lizard‚Äôs hidden wings, meet nature's awesome secret weapons.

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how leopards hunt prey both large and small, offering a new perspective on the way these silent killers stalk and ambush everything from impala to wildebeest and catfish to storks. A female leopard deploys stealth, strength and agility to take down prey on land, in water and from the air.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin heads into the constant heat, humidity and rainfall of the Australian rainforests to find out what it takes to be ‚ÄúBuilt to Survive.‚Äù In the leafy canopy, Phil encounters the elusive tree kangaroo and its young joey, as well as Australia‚Äôs largest snake, the lethal scrub python. On the forest floor, the colorful cassowary acts as the rainforest‚Äôs gardener.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Within the Channel Country deserts, Indigenous educator Phil Breslin scours the endless sands to find three animals that not only survive the heat but thrive in unrelenting conditions. Get ready to meet Australia‚Äôs most impressive animals: the perentie, the continent‚Äôs largest lizard; the emu, its fastest flightless bird; and the mighty red kangaroo, the world‚Äôs largest marsupial.

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how Nile crocodiles hunt, offering new perspectives on the patient and precise tactics they use when ambushing migratory herds of wildebeest and zebra that pass through their territories. A male crocodile must target large prey in a bid to survive the harshest time of the year.

programme.title: Shark Attack 360
programme.desc: Diva uncovers a mysterious spate of shark bites in California. But these bites are in the winter when the sharks are usually long gone. To understand the reasons behind this cluster of encounters the 360 team gets to work. As they scour the world for clues, their investigation takes them to Israel, Australia and South Africa.

A male crocodile must target large prey in a bid to survive the harshest time of the year.

programme.title: Shark Attack 360
programme.desc: Diva uncovers a mysterious spate of shark bites in California. But these bites are in the winter when the sharks are usually long gone. To understand the reasons behind this cluster of encounters the 360 team gets to work. As they scour the world for clues, their investigation takes them to Israel, Australia and South Africa.

programme.title: Shark Attack 360
programme.desc: The 360 team investigate a spate of shark attacks in Ballina, a small seaside town just on the east coast of Australia. The team puts local theories to the test, myth busting old beliefs and revealing fascinating shark biology. In the lab, Diva analyses the data and uncovers a starling truth behind these bites.

programme.title: Shark Attack 360
programme.desc: The 360 team investigates an attack on a foil boarder in Australia. Are sharks attracted to these boards and does something stimulate an attack? Meeting with hydrodynamic experts, the team discovers that these boards may trigger sharks. In the field, the team examine how and why.

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how leopards hunt prey both large and small, offering a new perspective on the way these silent killers stalk and ambush everything from impala to wildebeest and catfish to storks. A female leopard deploys stealth, strength and agility to take down prey on land, in water and from the air.

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how polar bears hunt prey, offering new perspectives on the tactics they use to track, stalk and ambush seals, whales and walruses. We follow a mother fighting to feed her two cubs in the harsh polar extremes, and a young male driven by starvation to tackle enormous prey.

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how lions hunt large prey like buffalo and zebra, offering new perspectives on the way these predators stalk, chase and kill. A lone lioness relies on cunning to feed her newborn cubs, whilst a fearless pride tries to take down the biggest prey of all, a giant African elephant. .

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how cheetahs hunt their prey, offering new perspectives on the tactics employed by these expert predators when stalking, chasing and bringing down antelope and wildebeest. Following a young cheetah mother over 18-months as she teaches her three cubs the secrets of the hunt.

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how Nile crocodiles hunt, offering new perspectives on the patient and precise tactics they use when ambushing migratory herds of wildebeest and zebra that pass through their territories. A male crocodile must target large prey in a bid to survive the harshest time of the year.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol: Compilation
programme.desc: When a slew of animals come to Pol Vet with life-threatening injuries, the vets spring into action. A cat struck by an arrow, a dog hurting from taking on a much bigger foe, and a pregnant horse who has a run in with a fence are just a sampling of the intense cases that come calling. Doc and his team take on these challenges without hesitation, all in the name of saving animal‚Äôs lives.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol: Compilation
programme.desc: Furry, feathered, scaly and sick? Pol Vet will treat anyone who isn‚Äôt human, and sees a variety of rare and unusual creature companions. Doc can check a cow for pregnancy, but how about a camel? A turtle with indigestion, chinchilla checkup and kangaroo toothache keep things interesting at the clinic, and when Merlin the macaw has an overgrown beak, Dr. Pol gives him a much needed macaw-icure.

programme.title: Underdogs
programme.desc: Ryan shares his distinct take on the underdogs using gross-out tactics to win the game of life. With manatees using flatulence to control their buoyancy to cave-dwelling fungus gnats creating beautifully illuminated flytraps with mucus from their butts, these underdogs are out to prove who may be the grossest survivor of them all.

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: Animals survive by using camouflage, mimicry, and stealth tactics. From tigers who hunt in plain sight using their orange fur as camouflage, and a spider who mimics an ant to sneak into a colony, to a bird that uses false alarm calls to trick meerkats into giving up their prey, nature deploys remarkable deception to survive.
